intro: Leptospermum scoparium var. juniperinum, commonly known as Manuka, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, leathery leaves that are typically reddish-brown in color. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, urn-shaped berries. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Manuka is well-known for its medicinal properties and is widely used in traditional Māori medicine.
